intro: Hulthemia persica, commonly known as Persian hulthemia, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It has a compact growth habit with hairy leaves and produces fruit that is a capsule containing numerous seeds. Hulthemia persica is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
